name: The Family Law
description: An exploration of Asian representation on screens around the world that delves into TV, cinema, documentaries and Disney princesses.

key_work.title: The Family Law
key_work.brief_description: Based on Benjamin Law’s 2010 book, The Family Law was the first Australian TV show to focus on an Asian Australian family. While it explores familiar stories about an everyday family, it offers a unique perspective on what it means to be Australian today.

constellations_primary.name: The Family Law
constellations_primary.description: An exploration of Asian representation on screens around the world that delves into TV, cinema, documentaries and Disney princesses.

constellations_other.name: Ana Kokkinos
constellations_other.description: The films and TV works of Ana Kokkinos often explore the experiences of second-generation Australians, queer identities and class. Since beginning her career in the early 90s, those stories have started to appear more frequently on Australian screens.

constellations_other.name: Tony Ayres
constellations_other.description: Charts the acclaimed career of Tony Ayres through his work in film and TV.

end.title: Ronny Chieng: International Student
end.brief_description: Ronny is a Malaysian student who’s come to Australia to study law. Though smart, driven and competitive, he’s also blunt and barbed, so it’s not long before Ronny is at odds with most people on campus.

constellations_other.name: The Family Law
constellations_other.description: An exploration of Asian representation on screens around the world that delves into TV, cinema, documentaries and Disney princesses.

links.description: Shuang Hu, who plays Candy in The Family Law, starred in the TV series Ronny Chieng: International Student. Created by Australian-based Malaysian comedian Ronny Chieng, the series is partly based on Chieng’s experiences as a law student in Melbourne.

start.title: Ronny Chieng: International Student
start.brief_description: Ronny is a Malaysian student who’s come to Australia to study law. Though smart, driven and competitive, he’s also blunt and barbed, so it’s not long before Ronny is at odds with most people on campus.

end.title: Crazy Rich Asians
end.creator_credit: Brad Simpson, John Penotti, Nina Jacobson and Bryan Unkeless
end.brief_description: An American-born Chinese economics professor accompanies her boyfriend to Singapore for his best friend’s wedding, only to get thrust into the lives of Asia’s rich and famous.

constellations_other.name: Legacy of an icon: Anna May Wong
constellations_other.description: Wong Liu Tsong, known professionally as Anna May Wong, was a film star in the 1920s and 30s who made a career for herself despite racist stereotypes and vilification. Her legacy lives on as she is now being portrayed by contemporary actors on film and TV.

constellations_other.name: The Family Law
constellations_other.description: An exploration of Asian representation on screens around the world that delves into TV, cinema, documentaries and Disney princesses.

links.description: Ronny Chieng went on to star in the box office hit Crazy Rich Asians alongside an all-star cast. The film grossed over $238 million worldwide, making it the highest-grossing romantic comedy in a decade.

start.title: Crazy Rich Asians
start.creator_credit: Brad Simpson, John Penotti, Nina Jacobson and Bryan Unkeless
start.brief_description: An American-born Chinese economics professor accompanies her boyfriend to Singapore for his best friend’s wedding, only to get thrust into the lives of Asia’s rich and famous.

end.title: The Joy Luck Club
end.creator_credit: Wayne Wang, Amy Tan, Patrick Markey, Ronald Bass, Donald Graham Burt and Lydia Tanji
end.headline_credit: China, United States and United States of America, 1993
end.brief_description: Based on Amy Tan’s best-selling novel, The Joy Luck Club tells the story of two generations of Chinese women and spans from feudal China to modern America while highlighting the similarities and differences between the two generations.

constellations_other.name: The Family Law
constellations_other.description: An exploration of Asian representation on screens around the world that delves into TV, cinema, documentaries and Disney princesses.

links.description: When released in 2018, Crazy Rich Asians was the first big Hollywood film starring a majority cast of Asian descent in a contemporary setting since The Joy Luck Club. Noted for its distinctly female lens, 50 of the film’s 60 speaking parts are female.

start.title: The Joy Luck Club
start.creator_credit: Wayne Wang, Amy Tan, Patrick Markey, Ronald Bass, Donald Graham Burt and Lydia Tanji
start.headline_credit: China, United States and United States of America, 1993
start.brief_description: Based on Amy Tan’s best-selling novel, The Joy Luck Club tells the story of two generations of Chinese women and spans from feudal China to modern America while highlighting the similarities and differences between the two generations.

end.title: Mulan
end.creator_credit: David Reynolds, Rita Hsiao, Philip LaZebnik, Lorna Cook, Burny Mattinson, Tony Bancroft, Barry Cook, Chris Sanders, Hans Bacher, Floyd Norman, Walt Disney Animation Studios, Pam Coats, Raymond Singer, Eugenia Bostwick-Singer, Joe Grant, Chris Williams, Barry Johnson, John Sanford, Tim Hodge, Thom Enriquez, Ed Gombert and Julius Aguimatang
end.headline_credit: United States and United States of America, 1998
end.brief_description: This animated feature focuses on a feisty young woman who rejects marriage to become a warrior in ancient China. When the Emperor conscripts recruits to defend China against the invading Huns, Mulan disguises herself as a man and takes her father’s place in the army.

constellations_other.name: The Family Law
constellations_other.description: An exploration of Asian representation on screens around the world that delves into TV, cinema, documentaries and Disney princesses.

links.description: The animated film Mulan features the first, and currently only, East Asian female lead to be part of the Disney Princess franchise. Mulan is voiced by Ming-Na Wen who also stared in The Joy Luck Club. The live action adaptation of the film stars Chinese-born actor Liu Yifei.

start.title: Mulan
start.creator_credit: David Reynolds, Rita Hsiao, Philip LaZebnik, Lorna Cook, Burny Mattinson, Tony Bancroft, Barry Cook, Chris Sanders, Hans Bacher, Floyd Norman, Walt Disney Animation Studios, Pam Coats, Raymond Singer, Eugenia Bostwick-Singer, Joe Grant, Chris Williams, Barry Johnson, John Sanford, Tim Hodge, Thom Enriquez, Ed Gombert and Julius Aguimatang
start.headline_credit: United States and United States of America, 1998
start.brief_description: This animated feature focuses on a feisty young woman who rejects marriage to become a warrior in ancient China. When the Emperor conscripts recruits to defend China against the invading Huns, Mulan disguises herself as a man and takes her father’s place in the army.

constellations_other.description: An exploration of Asian representation on screens around the world that delves into TV, cinema, documentaries and Disney princesses.

end.title: Ai Weiwei: Never Sorry
end.creator_credit: Expressions United Media, MUSE Film and Television, Never Sorry, Adam Schlesinger and Alison Klayman
end.brief_description: Director Alison Klayman chronicles the complexities of Ai Wei Wei’s life for three years, beginning with his rise to public prominence via blog and Twitter after he questioned the deaths of more than 5,000 students in the 2008 Sichuan earthquake.

constellations_other.name: The Family Law
constellations_other.description: An exploration of Asian representation on screens around the world that delves into TV, cinema, documentaries and Disney princesses.

links.description: Liu Yifei attended the Performance Institute of Beijing Film Academy. So did Chinese contemporary artist, filmmaker and activist, Ai Weiwei. Alison Klayman’s documentary Ai Weiei: Never Sorry follows the artist preparing a series of exhibitions amid increasing tensions with the Chinese government.
